Pathways: Soil/growing medium; Plants for planting (except seeds bulbs and tubers)

Regulation: This species is not a plant pathogenic fungus but a lichen species.  Please note; there is a separate species; the cause of grapevine root rot pathogen - Roesleria subterranea - "The name R. pallida had been miss-used frequently to refer to a fungus which is in reality R. subterranea (= Roesleria hypogaea) (Beckwith 1924). Dennis (1978) considered R. pallida as a synonym of R. hypogaea. However; the name Roesleria pallida (Pers.) Sacc. based on Calicium pallidum Pers. is not applicable to the grape root parasite (Redhead 1984; Beckwith 1924). Its current name is Sclerophora pallida (Pers.) Y.J. Yao & Spooner. According to Redhead (1984); Dennis (1978) gave a description of R. subterranea under the name R. pallida. " (http://www.padil.gov.au/pests-and-diseases/pest/main/136618/4410) Therefore; we are unclear if the correct organism has been legislated for.
